results.title: Sun on the stubble
results.creator_credit: FA, ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Terry Jennings and Robert Marchand
results.brief_description: Bruno Gunter, a 14 year-old boy from a German immigrant family grows up on a wheat farm in South Australia during the 1930’s. Even though his father is strict and an advocate of hard work, Bruno finds plenty of mischief and adventure. He has to deal with a new school teacher, the feud between Jack Ryan and Hermann Heinz as well as coping with his family. This adaptation of Thiele’s novels will delight the family as a byegone era is vividly recreated and a period of Australia’s history and heritage is bought to life. Starring Jamie Croft as Bruno, Christian Kohlund as his father and Susan Lyons as his mother. Based on four novels written by Colin Thiele.

results.title: Sun Kosi: river of gold
results.creator_credit: Nomad Films International and Douglas Stanley
results.brief_description: Documents the progress of the 1981 Australian Himalayan Kayak Expedition down the 340 kilometre Sun Kosi River of Nepal. The first attempt to paddle the river, the trip combined danger and discovery as the men tackled the treacherous elements in a land untouched by the pressures of the Western world. Suitable for lower and middle secondary level.

results.title: Sun flight
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and Gerald McDermot
results.brief_description: An animated recounting of the ancient Greek myth of Daedalus and Icarus. Portrays the creation of the Labyrinth on Crete, the imprisonment of Daedalus and Icarus by King Minos, the construction of wings for their escape, and the tragic flight of Icarus to the sun. Stylised graphic design, intensive colour and exciting music are used.

results.title: Sumo do, Sumo don't = Shiko funjatta
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company, Cabin Productions, Yo Yamamoto, Izuru Hiraaki and Masayuki Suo
results.brief_description: Two students at Tokyo University, the irresponsible Shubei and the ineffectual Aoki, set out to build up the university sumo club. They coopt a sad-sack, a drag wrestler and a foreigner who refuses to “undress” in the right way, to form a team to uphold the honour of the alma mater at the forthcoming wrestling tournament. Unorthodox methods are called for. They are aided in their prodigious training regime by Masako, the screen’s first female sumo wrestler. To the familiar victory-against-all-odds theme is added an extra dimension— a serious look at how the West has radically influenced traditional Japanese culture. Cast includes Masahiro Motoki, Misa Shimizu, Naoto Takenaka and Hiromasa Taguchi. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Sumner Locke Elliot
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Filmed in New York, December 1985. Sumner Locke Elliott recalls the characters and events of his youth which inspired his autobiographical novels. He began his career as an actor at the Independent Theatre in Sydney and went on to write and peform for radio. In 1948 Elliott left Australia and settled permanently in New York where he wrote television plays and later novels. He discusses different attitudes in Australia and America and the changes he has seen take place in American society.

results.title: Summit seekers: the ascent of Sterling Peak, New Zealand
results.brief_description: Shows the mighty ranges of New Zealand’s Southern Alps, a tumultuous ocean of snows, present on all sides and the alpine pioneers who are courageous enough to climb these icy slopes. Mt Sterling is the highest peak.

results.title: Summing up
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Mark Hamlyn and Bryan Bruty
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Huw Evan presents this final program in the series, in which experts with varying concerns and criticisms about the treatment of psychiatric disorders confront two psychiatrists. Each topic is illustrated by excerpts from the previous programs. Some of the issues discussed are the use of electro-convulsive therapy, treatment with drugs and enforced hospitalisation.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Rob McCubbin

results.title: Summerhill (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Cecily Burwash and Dennis Miller
results.brief_description: Visits England’s progressive co-educational boarding school, Summerhill, founded by Alexander Neill a half century ago. Aims to show that students can make decisions about their studies without lessening the quality of their education.
